docs.lead_paragraph: Oregon officials are backing off their proposal to prohibit sales of pot-infused treats at Oregon medical marijuana stores after receiving hundreds of emailed comments opposing the ban.

headline.main: Oregon Drops Proposed Ban on Pot-Laced Munchies
headline.print_headline: Oregon Drops Proposed Ban on Pot-Laced Munchies

docs.snippet: Oregon officials are backing off their proposal to prohibit sales of pot-infused treats at Oregon medical marijuana stores after receiving hundreds of emailed comments opposing the ban.

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge on Monday refused to block new Arizona rules limiting the use of the most common abortion drugs, handing a victory to conservatives in a lawsuit over restrictions that are the most stringent in the nation.

headline.main: Judge Won't Block New Arizona Abortion Drug Rules
headline.print_headline: Judge Won't Block New Arizona Abortion Drug Rules

docs.snippet: A federal judge on Monday refused to block new Arizona rules limiting the use of the most common abortion drugs, handing a victory to conservatives in a lawsuit over restrictions that are the most stringent in the nation.

docs.lead_paragraph: With just hours to spare, Congress stepped Monday to finalize legislation to prevent doctors who treat Medicare patients from being hit with a 24 percent cut in their payments from the government.

headline.main: Congress Passes Bill to Stop Cut to Medicare Docs
headline.print_headline: Congress Passes Bill to Stop Cut to Medicare Docs

docs.snippet: With just hours to spare, Congress stepped Monday to finalize legislation to prevent doctors who treat Medicare patients from being hit with a 24 percent cut in their payments from the government.

docs.lead_paragraph: Millions have gained coverage through private plans and expanded Medicaid, but costs still hinder some, and many providers are struggling to adjust to an influx of patients.

headline.main: In New Health Care Era, Blessings and Hurdles
headline.print_headline: In New Health Care Era, Blessings and Hurdles

docs.abstract: Community health centers nationwide are struggling to accommodate millions of new patients under Affordable Care Act, many of whom have a disproportionate number of health problems; centers welcome new source of revenue, but sheer number of patients and new electronic record systems present challenges; stories of three newly insured patients illustrate dilemma (Series: Remaking Medicine).
docs.snippet: Millions have gained coverage through private plans and expanded Medicaid, but costs still hinder some, and many providers are struggling to adjust to an influx of patients.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

byline.contributor: Emma Cott and Erica Berenstein contributed reporting.
